page.title: 09ECOLOGY IN R.BURE
page.content: {ECOLOGY {RIVER BURE The river Bure runs through the south west corner of the area under survey. It eventually reaches the sea at Gt.Yarmouth some 40 miles away. Mr.Robbins the water bailiff for the stretch of river near Erping ham provided the following info; "The water is very clean and pure,relatively free from pesticides and fertilisers as it runs through mainly pasture and woodland." {FISH CENSUS 300m.of river -200 trout to 35cms. also present were eels,gudgeon,loaches and 1 perch.Insect pop.abundant-many mayflies.Also crayfish andfreshwater shrimp. {Water temp.low as the water comes {mainly from underground. { }
